text: Found in the metal ark beneath Xhotl, the Cube of Darkness is as alien as it is powerful. Viewed up close, this small black cube contains millions of tiny pin-pricks of blinking light, each circling a sphere of pure darkness. By implementing the correct pattern of thoughts, the cube may be opened for a fraction of a second, inexpleciably drawing the very Winds of Magic into its depths.

The Crown's whispered advice lured Azhag into an ambush whereupon he was slain by Arkhan the Black, greatest of Nagash's servants. With the Crown now in his possession, the Great Necromancer's return is imminent.

This holy relic still bears the image of the Bretonnian hero's body, imprinted with his blood when he was mortally wounded. The Cultists of Tzeentch now use this sacred blood of the slain hero in their profane rituals.

Ghal Maraz is the legendary hammer of Sigmar and one of the most potent magical artefacts in the entire world. This rune-encrusted weapon has been the symbol of the Emperor's office ever since the founding of the Empire.
This ancient artifact of the Old Ones was once wielded by the legendary Saurus Kroq-Gar, before his defeat at the hands of Kairos Fateweaver. It has been repurposed into a weapon of dread power.

Brought to the world by the Old Ones, this weapon shimmers with unnatural power. Legends carved on ancient stone claim the blade exists on every plane of reality simultaneously, and that its edge can sever a creature's soul. No earthly force can stop this deadly blade - it penetrates granite and steel as easily as it slices through flesh and bone.

This lance was crafted from the heart of the Major Oak, the largest tree in Bretonnia, which was shattered by lightning the moment Gilles was struck down. Its blackened wood is covered with tiny carvings depicting the twelve battles of Gilles and, despite being harder than stone and diamond sharp, it is lightweight and beautiful to behold.
Cube of Darkness
The Crown of Sorcery
The Shroud of Gilles le Breton
Ghal Maraz
Repurposed Hand of Gods
The Blade of Realities
The Heartwood Lance
Scourge
Profaned Sword of Couronne
Moonstone of the Hidden Ways
Mirror of the Ice Queen
Scourge is a lethal whip, thirsty for blood and wrapped in the bitter curses of many generations of Bray-Shamans.

This powerful heirloom was forged from the finest Bretonnian siverline. It catches the sun's rays and magnifies them, dazzling the foe as the wielder makes their death stroke. It is now stained with the golden blood of Bretonnia's Royarch.

In ages past, the worldroots linked Athel Loren not only with every forest upon the face of the world, but those further afield also. Much has changed since those days. Many pathways are now forever closed, and those that remain can be unsealed only through the use of this ancient Moonstone.
A hand mirror fashioned from flawless ice and bound within an intricate frame of frostwork. A gift from the Ice Queen to Azazel, so that he can gaze upon his beautiful form whenever he deems fit.
Blade of Corruption
This sword was left for 13 days in the dreaded Cauldron of a Thousand Poxes before it was presented to the Leechlord as a gesture of peace from Clan Pestilens.
Warp Scroll
This copied magical script outlines techniques from the great Liber Bubonicus. It has been written in warpstone ink on flayed hides of those unable to withstand the Great Horned Rat's gifts.
Yueyin's Diamond
This brilliant crystal shines with the light of the true moon itself. Its touch is anaethama to daemons, and even to stare upon it is to risk banishment back to the Realms of Chaos.
The Rock of Inevitability

Deep in the Realm of Chaos sits the Inevitable City. It is an ageless edifice that lies ever distant from those who seek to reach it, and shadows every step taken by those who wish to escape it. The city has been destroyed many times, but has always rebuilt itself - and always will so long as a single stone remains. Indeed, if but one worn brick from its walls is planted in the mortal realm, it is said that a new city will soon arise.
Witstealer Sword
Forged in the molten heat of desire and cooled in a vat of Slaanesh's own blood, the Witstealer Sword was presented to the Arch-tempter by the Dark Prince himself.
Sliverslash
It is said Prince Sigvald's ornate sword is forged from a sliver of Slaanesh's own blade. It moves like quicksilver, striking its foes down in a flurry of lightning-quick blows.
The Warpsword of Khaine
The Time of Blood is at hand!
Superior Collar of Khorne

Valkia's hellsmiths have used the blood of the slain Ice Witches to create a uniquely superior Collar of Khorne. This rune-etched brass collar will protect the wearer from all but the most grevious of magical attacks.
The Slayer of Kings

The Second Everchosen, Vangel, trapped the Greater Daemon U'zuhl inside this regicidal blade. Aeons of imprisonment inside the blade have driven the Daemon insane with rage. In battle, the blade moans with barely contained fury.
The Armour of Morkar
Once belonging to the First Everchosen of Chaos, this ancient suit of Chaos Armour is as powerful as those who have dared to wear it.
The Eye of Sheerian
Named after the Tzeentchian Sorcerer who discovered it, the Eye sees nearly all. Its current owner should make use of its prophetic powers...
Liberated Black Dragon Egg

In Ulthuan, the egg of a Dragon is sacred, and harsh punishment awaits any who endanger or disturb a Dragon nest. For the Vampires, a Dragon egg is naught but a potential source of power, and their nests nothing but cradles to nurture that power. This particular egg was liberated from the clutches of the Lahmian Sisterhood. Shackolot has vowed to raise it to maturity.
Dragonfire Staff

This gnarled staff of Helman's own design was carved from a rotten branch from the Haunted Forest. It is adorned with an ornate silver topper shaped like the head of a dragon, a powerful arcane artifact pillaged from a Cathayan caravan.
Eye of the Deep
An intricately crafted orb of unknown material that shimmers with an otherworldly light. Cylostra received it from a strange entity she encountered in the Underworld Sea.
Golden Lamp

While doing battle with Arabyan cultists, Henri and Repanse were set upon by a Fire-Djinn. Henri managed to outsmart the spirit by appealing to its pride, loudly declaring that it couldn't possibly contain its tempestuous form into so small a receptacle. The djinn was only too eager to prove Henri wrong, and shortly thereafter found itself imprisoned. Repanse sought to destroy it, but the Prophetesses persuaded her to stay her hand so that they can continue to study it.
The Crown of Domination
An ancient battle-helm dating back to the time of Morkar, it exudes an aura of raw malice to cow the servants of Chaos.
Vilitch's Locket

This ornate silver locket hangs around Archaon's neck at all times, threatening to throttle him at the slightest sign of disobedience. At times its filigreed surface slides open, revealing a blinking, living eye through which the Curseling sees all.
Blade of Shadow
A lesser blade forged from shadow magic siphoned from Be'lakor himself. Since the Godslayer spoke his True Name, he was incapable of resisting the act.
Shard Blade
The blade of Boris Ursus was crafted from the glaciers of Norsca and magically bound to remain forever frozen. When this mighty polearm strikes, the foe's blood turns to ice.
Gitsnik
This formidable axe came from the forges of Zharr Naggrund and, despite constant use, has never grown dull.
Blood-Forged Armour
After being forged under Red Eye Mountain, this armour was cooled with the blood of Dwarf Runesmiths.
Cracked Rune of Azamar

Though the Rune of Azamar's once flawless perfection is now marred by a single crack running down its centre, it still resonates with latent power. The rune was prised from the High King’s Throne of Power and now serves as an indisputable symbol of the conquest of Karaz-a-Karak.
Dragonscale Cloak
This cloak was fashioned from the flayed corpse of Zhao Ming, the Iron Dragon. Though it offers significant protection, it is heavily tainted by the corrupting influence of warpstone.\\n
Writ of Iron
A formal decree carved on flayed flesh, outlining Astragoth’s approval for immediate construction works to be undertaken by the bearer.
Blood-Rune Bracers
These obsidian bracers were forged from the daemonic essence of a Lord of Change. The blood-red runes glow with an eldritch power that grants the wielder control of their enemies’ fate.
Dragon Heart

This bloody organ was ripped from the corpse of the Storm Dragon by the victorious Dragonslayer Zhatan the Black. It crackles with barely contained energy, the Supreme Matriarch’s wrath lingering even in death.
Chittering Crossbow
This strange weapon fires daemonic bolts that cackle wildly as they speed towards the foe before exploding in a multicoloured fireball.
Staff of Oblivion

This bladed staff holds a glowing blue orb at its base which pulses with eldritch power. A skinless daemonic worm has wrapped itself around the orb and is leeching most of the orb’s energy, thus protecting the wielder from certain death.
Flensing Gauntlet
This metal gauntlet has hidden compartments across the knuckles that spring open to unleash a swarm of sorcerous wires which dart forth with a mind of their own to lacerate and entangle the foe.
Volcanic Morningstar
Fused in the molten core of Infernius, this morningstar shatters bone and ignites flesh with every swing.
Blissbarb Bow
Each serrated arrow is laced with toxins that renders the foe insensate - a willing victim for the unending cruelties to come.
Abyssal Whip
Allegedly made from the spine of an extinct breed of daemon, every lash of this whip flays flesh and exposes bone. Death comes slow for those exposed to its caresses.
Axe of Dargo
The Axe of Dargo, a runic weapon of monstrous size, is tempered with dragon's blood and oaths of vengeance.
The Eight-Pointed Star
This unholy talisman shudders with the power of no less than four bound Greater Daemons. The Daemonsmiths laboured for many weeks in the hell-forges to bring about its creation.
Mecha-Arm

Drazh-Zharr justice demanded Grimgor's hand be struck off for daring to raise it against his master. Yet Astragoth is prudent as well as just. He ensured his greatest Labourer was outfitted with a mechanical replacement.
Sorcerous Shackles
These chains radiate with Hashut's malign will and so subjugate Grimgor in perpetuity.
The Black Hammer of Hashut
This black-shafted hammer was taken from Astragoth's petrified corpse after his ultimate defeat at the hands of Grimgor Ironhide. It bears a horned rune of Hashut that glows with dark fire.
Daemonspite Crucible

Forged from meteoric iron and blighted gold, quenched in innocent blood and bound with slain, hell-bound souls, the Crucible is said to have been the handiwork of the ancient Chaos Dwarf Sorcerer Azgorh himself.
Shadow Ruby
Within this blood-red ruby swirls Be'lakor's ensnared soul. The daemon rages against the faceted walls of his prison, but there is no hope of escape.
Red Fang
This large, gore-drenched choppa once belonged to the legendary Orc Chieftan Gorfang Rotgut. The Squatter King met his end in a legendary duel against Malagor atop the battlements of Black Crag.
Tainted Blade of Ptra
This sword's white-hot edge is infused with the desert's baking heat, setting the air itself ablaze and blinding the foe.
Armour of Templehof
A product of twisted sorcery, this construct fuses with the wearer, giving him tremendous endurance.
Jade Griffon Banner
Even the faith of mighty Volkmar was sorely tested as he was taken up and chained to the battle standard of Malagor's warherd.
Profaned Sword of Lyonesse
Smeared in the blood and ash of its previous owner, this once holy blade now radiates with a fell power.
Mask of Heavens
The ancient magic of Tiktaq'to's mask is used by the Bray-Shamans to dominate the minds of the wilful Minotaurs.
Bloodstained Pendant
This ithilmar pendant, inset with a flawlessly carved brightstone, was gifted to Thorek Ironbrow by the High Loremaster Teclis as a gesture of peace and friendship.
Hunting Trophy
The Wanderer didn't wander far enough. His severed head now takes pride of place in the Huntsmarshal's trophy hall.
Cursed Artifact of No'Tidoq
This ancient artifact glows with an eldritch light, filling one's mind with a bestial fury.
Cracked Rune of Azamar

Though the Rune of Azamar's once flawless perfection is now marred by a single crack running down its centre, it still resonates with latent power. The rune was prised from the High King’s Throne of Power and now serves as an indisputable symbol of the Grand Chieftain's conquest.
Grey Seer Summoner
With a series of whispered words and intricate gestures, this Grey Seer can summon Fozzrik's Flying Fortress to the battlefield.
Kratch's Doomclaw
This crude, oversized warpstone-powered claw can easily slice through flesh and bone. It was taken from the corpse of Kratch Doomclaw, the previous ruler of Clan Rictus.
Rictus Plate Armour
This suit of plate armour is comprised entirely of warpstone. The chestpiece is engraved with Clan Rictus' symbol.
Lustrian Concoction

A potent mixture of extracted Itxi grub humours, crushed Jungle Lotus leaves and Coatl feathers grants the imbiber renewed vitality and an unparalleled mastery of the Winds of Magic... at least until the effects wear off.
Cathayan Concoction

A potent mixture of powdered Ki-rin horn, crushed Jade Lion teeth and Onyx Crowmen feathers grants the imbiber renewed vitality and an unparalleled mastery of the Winds of Magic... at least until the effects wear off.
